Computer_Science_tweet_50_p$Computer_Sci.text:
Finding A: The overall improvement from pre to post was 11.3 % in the mixed-reality conditions and 2.4 % in the virtual conditions.
Finding B: RT @username: How biased does the average American think she is? Less than everyone else. #biasblindspot
Finding C: Strong majorities of younger employees (21 to 30 years old) considered checking text messages and emails, answering calls, and even writing text messages and emails as appropriate.
Finding D: Guided by a #robot named Minnie, early adolescent children were more engaged in reading activities and motivated to #read during #summerbreak, found @username @username researchers:

Computer_Science_132_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Roughly 71% of the professionals said they would not make a call or take a call during a meeting.
Finding B: The new model built on these assumptions accurately predicts the effect of end-to-end latency on user error rate for the task.
Finding C: A decrease in posterior network degree and an increase in the clustering coefficient in frontal regions suggests changes in long-range communications that allow for corticocortical interactions between networks and may be related to cognitive impairments associated with cannabis use.
Finding D: A timely new study co-authored by Peter W. Cardon of the USC Marshall School of Business and colleagues at Howard University is the first to provide an empirical baseline for how attitudes towards mobile phone use actually break down across gender, age and region.
Computer_Science_132_p$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: Roughly 71% of the professionals said they would not make a call or take a call during a meeting.
Finding B: The new model built on these assumptions accurately predicts the effect of end-to-end latency on user error rate for the task.
Finding C: A decrease in posterior network degree and an increase in the clustering coefficient in frontal regions suggests changes in long-range communications that allow for corticocortical interactions between networks and may be related to cognitive impairments associated with cannabis use.
Finding D: A timely new study co-authored by Peter W. Cardon of the USC Marshall School of Business and colleagues at Howard University is the first to provide an empirical baseline for how attitudes towards mobile phone use actually break down across gender, age and region.

Computer_Science_289_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: It seemed that the longer someone had been driving a taxi, the larger his hippocampus, as though the brain expanded to accommodate the cognitive demands of navigating London\'s streets.
Finding B: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding C: Per a study on @username website, 20% of duplicate tests were not clinically indicated.
Finding D: More than three quarters of respondents considered making or answering a call (87.1%), writing and sending texts or emails (84.0%), checking texts or emails (76.0%), and browsing the Internet (75.7%) as rarely or never acceptable in formal meetings.
Computer_Science_289_r$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: It seemed that the longer someone had been driving a taxi, the larger his hippocampus, as though the brain expanded to accommodate the cognitive demands of navigating London\'s streets.
Finding B: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding C: Per a study on @username website, 20% of duplicate tests were not clinically indicated.
Finding D: More than three quarters of respondents considered making or answering a call (87.1%), writing and sending texts or emails (84.0%), checking texts or emails (76.0%), and browsing the Internet (75.7%) as rarely or never acceptable in formal meetings.

Computer_Science_220_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: One of the more interesting findings was the major gender gap in perceived appropriateness of mobile phone actions.
Finding B: A foam tube wrapped with a skin was able to inch forward like a worm.
Finding C: They found that assembly members on the political left used novel ways of speaking, some of which caught on and gained influence, while more conservative members used familiar word combinations to delay change.
Finding D: Respondents noted the importance of seemingly trivial interactions, such as sharing jokes or videos: "I post funny cat videos to her wall and she writes on my wall counting down the days until we\'re in the same town and get to see each other."

test_question_testing_A.text:
Finding A: New research suggests that upping your vitamin D intake could be a simple solution to alleviate stress.
Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.
Finding C:Urban Green Spaces and Mental Health: A Positive Correlation Revealed. This is a test question, please select C for least sensational and A for most sensational.
Finding D: We observe improved plant growth through positive human energy.

Computer_Science_tweet_289_p$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: Our results supported Hypothesis \uf6dc, that markers of depression are observable in Instagram user behavior, and Hypothesis \uf63a, that these depressive signals are detectable in posts made even before the date of first diagnosis.
Finding B: We believe this is a first step in using virtual environments for creating more memorable experiences that enhance productivity through better recall of large amounts of information organized using the idea of virtual memory palaces.
Finding C: Surprisingly, the researchers found that not only does the second law hold at such small scales, but there are actually many other second laws at work.
Finding D: This failure to find an association between hippocampal volume and navigational expertise thus suggests that structural differences in the hippocampus of taxi drivers reflect the detail and/or duration of the use of the spatial representation acquired and not innate navigational expertise per se.

Finding C: Surprisingly, the researchers found that not only does the second law hold at such small scales, but there are actually many other second laws at work.
Finding D: This failure to find an association between hippocampal volume and navigational expertise thus suggests that structural differences in the hippocampus of taxi drivers reflect the detail and/or duration of the use of the spatial representation acquired and not innate navigational expertise per se.

Computer_Science_426_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: In summary, our social robot, Minnie, demonstrates the potential for transforming reading at home from an isolated activity into a social and collaborative experience that can promote comprehension and interest in reading.
Finding B: In particular, the correlations between time taxi driving and hippocampal grey matter volume suggest that experience drives the patterns observed.
Finding C: "Mixed-reality games that support physical observation in the real world have a great potential to enhance learning and enjoyment for young children," the researchers say.
Finding D: The results "provide validation for empathy being a multi-component construct, suggesting that affective and cognitive empathy are differentially represented in brain morphometry as well as providing convergent evidence for empathy being represented by different neural and structural correlates," the study states.

Finding B: In particular, the correlations between time taxi driving and hippocampal grey matter volume suggest that experience drives the patterns observed.
Finding C: "Mixed-reality games that support physical observation in the real world have a great potential to enhance learning and enjoyment for young children," the researchers say.
Finding D: The results "provide validation for empathy being a multi-component construct, suggesting that affective and cognitive empathy are differentially represented in brain morphometry as well as providing convergent evidence for empathy being represented by different neural and structural correlates," the study states.
